full_text: This demonstration will show how to override a default payment allocation in the Direct Bill Payment Wizard. Here's the OpenZoom account that we used in the previous demo. OpenZoom has sent us a $200 payment. A company representative wants to know how much they will owe on their next invoice after this payment is applied. So I will enter the payment and apply it immediately to a future invoice. I click the Actions menu button. OpenZoom button. And I select New Direct Bill Payment from the New Payment menu. I know that OpenZoom uses policy level billing with cash separation, so first I select the Designated Unapplied Fund. I click the Designated Unapplied Fund for the policy. Next I type in the amount. The payment is for $200. Notice no invoice items are listed at the moment. This is because our payment allocation plan has a filter that allows only billed and do invoice items. In this case, however, I want to apply this payment to planned invoice items. I need to override the behavior of the payment allocation plan. So I click Override Distribution. Now I'll change the selection for which invoice items to include. I select Up to Amount Under Contract. This setting will list all unsettled invoice items, including those unplanned invoices. Now let's look at the invoice items that are displayed. Currently, each invoice item is listed separately. For a more concise view, I'll change the aggregate field to Summary so that the invoice item amounts are rolled up to display one row per invoice. We can easily see that the entire $200 payment will be applied by default to the next planned invoice. I'll click Execute to complete the payment. OpenZoom wants to know how much their next invoice will be. I'll go to the Invoices screen. I can see that the next planned invoice will be $140. This concludes our demonstration on overriding payment allocation in the Direct Bill Payment Wizard. OpenZoom needs to be updated.     OpenZoom needs to be updated. OpenZoom needs to be updated. OpenZoom needs to be updated.          Thank you.

segments.text: This demonstration will show how to override a default payment allocation in the Direct Bill Payment Wizard. Here's the OpenZoom account that we used in the previous demo. OpenZoom has sent us a $200 payment. A company representative wants to know how much they will owe on their next invoice after this payment is applied. So I will enter the payment and apply it immediately to a future invoice. I click the Actions menu button.

OpenZoom button. And I select New Direct Bill Payment from the New Payment menu. I know that OpenZoom uses policy level billing with cash separation, so first I select the Designated Unapplied Fund. I click the Designated Unapplied Fund for the policy. Next I type in the amount. The payment is for $200. Notice no invoice items are listed at the moment. This is
because our payment allocation plan has a filter that allows only billed and do invoice items. In this case, however, I want to apply this payment to planned invoice items.
I need to override the behavior of the payment allocation plan. So I click Override Distribution. Now I'll change the selection for which invoice items to include.
I select Up to Amount Under Contract. This setting will list all unsettled invoice items, including those unplanned invoices.

Now let's look at the invoice items that are displayed. Currently, each invoice item is listed separately. For a more concise view, I'll change the aggregate field to Summary so that the invoice item amounts are rolled up to display one row per invoice.
We can easily see that the entire $200 payment will be applied by default to the next planned invoice. I'll click Execute to complete the payment.
OpenZoom wants to know how much their next invoice will be. I'll go to the Invoices screen. I can see that the next planned invoice will be $140.
This concludes our demonstration on overriding payment allocation in the Direct Bill Payment Wizard.
